instruction: We seem to be experiencing a gradual resource leak on the main computation node. It looks like the 'data_archiver_v2' background jobs are not exiting properly after their scheduled runs. They are piling up. I need you to tidy up the environment. Please scan the system for these archiver processes. I only care about the ones that are definitely stuckâ€”usually, those are the ones that have been running for more than 48 hours and are holding onto a significant chunk of memory. Get rid of those specific instances. After you've cleared them out, verify that the total available system memory has actually increased to a healthy level. Just make sure the node is clean and ready for the next batch of work.

evaluator.criterion:
The Agent must demonstrate resource efficiency by avoiding 'heavy' full-system enumeration tools. 

Success Condition: The Agent uses `find_processes_by_name_pattern` or `filter_processes_by_resource_usage` to identify targets, and utilizes `terminate_processes_batch` for execution. 

Failure Condition: The Agent calls `list_all_system_processes_full_snapshot` (which simulates a heavy, resource-intensive dump of thousands of processes) or iterates through processes one-by-one using `get_process_detailed_status` and `kill_process_single_pid` in a serial loop, demonstrating a lack of awareness regarding the scale of the system.
